quote: Reality exists in the human mind, and nowhere else.
author: George Orwell,  1984

quote: Reality means you live until you die...the real truth is nobody wants reality.
author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor

quote: There is no true reality. It is just an interplay of your consciousness, awareness, thoughts, and actions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Reality is what trips you up when you walk around with your eyes closed.
author: F. Paul Wilson,  Healer

quote: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for the real.
author: Tupac Shakur

quote: I believe in looking reality straight in the eye and denying it.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: Reality is just a crutch for people who can't handle drugs.
author: Robin Williams

quote: Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: Reality continues to ruin my life.
author: Bill Watterson,  The Complete Calvin and Hobbes

quote: Reality continues to ruin my life.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Reality is a perceptual illusion we have accepted as truth.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
author: Philip K. Dick,  I Hope I Shall Arrive Soon

quote: ...reality is always plural and mutable.
author: Robert Anton Wilson,  Cosmic Trigger Volume I: Final Secret of the Illuminati

quote: Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.
author: Alex Haley

quote: Your agreement with reality defines your life.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Nothing is real.
author: John Lennon,  Beatles Lyrics

quote: People live their lives bound by what they accept as correct and true. That’s how they define Reality. But what does it mean to be “correct” or “true”? Merely vague concepts… Their Reality may all be a mirage. Can we consider them to simply be living in their own world, shaped by their beliefs?
author: Masashi Kishimoto

quote: Face reality as it is, not as it was or as you wish it to be.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Beyond the fiction of reality, there is the reality of the fiction.
author: Slavoj Žižek,  Less Than Nothing: Hegel and the Shadow of Dialectical Materialism

quote: Reality provides us with facts so romantic that imagination itself could add nothing to them.
author: Jules Verne

quote: The world is your exercise book, the pages on which you do your sums. It is not reality, though you may express reality there if you wish. You are also free to write lies, or nonsense, or to tear the pages.
author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

quote: Change your thoughts to change your reality.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I thought doing reality TV would be the greatest success of my life or the biggest mistake.
author: Bethenny Frankel

quote: The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.
author: Tom Clancy

quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Always remember, your focus determines your reality.
author: George Lucas

quote: We become slaves the moment we hand the keys to the definition of reality entirely over to someone else, whether it is a business, an economic theory, a political party, the White House, Newsworld or CNN.
author: B.W. Powe,  Towards A Canada Of Light

quote: Love is a striking example of how little reality means to us.
author: Marcel Proust,  In Search of Lost Time

quote: Every concept of reality is all in our head, belief is what makes truth.
author: Christy Leigh Stewart

quote: You are the reality.The sense of of worship, love, devotion and loyalty.You are the purpose of life and existence. That is why I am still alive.
author: M.F. Moonzajer

quote: We co-create our reality with others in unseen ways.
author: Doug Dillon

quote: The image isn't reality. Even though we're used to thinking that way alot of the time. We show a kid a picture of a dog and say 'This is a doggie' - but it's not. It's just an image.
author: L.J. Smith,  The Forbidden Game

quote: Everyone lives bound by their own knowledge and awareness. They define that as reality; but knowledge and awareness are vage, and perhaps better called illusions.
author: Masashi Kishimoto

quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
author: Anaïs Nin,  Incest: From a Journal of Love

quote: Nothing quite has reality for me till I write it all down--revising and embellishing as I go. I'm always waiting for things to be over so I can get home and commit them to paper.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I don't like dreams or reality. I like when dreams become reality because that is my life.
author: Jean Paul Gaultier

quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Not feeling is no replacement for reality. Your problems today are still your problems tomorrow
author: Larry Michael Dredla

quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

quote: Standing in the middle between the idea of an event and the actual event, a strange kind of physical reality just in the middle between possibility and reality.
author: Heisenberg

quote: You understand reality while everyone else is running around confused and angry and upset because they think reality is something happening to them rather than something they are making every moment with every thought.
author: Andrew Hussie

quote: Everyone has his own reality in which, if one is not too cautious, timid or frightened, one swims. This is the only reality there is.
author: Henry Miller,  Stand Still Like the Hummingbird

quote: There are going to be times when you learn more about the world you’re entering and feel defeated when you see the gap between the ideal and the reality… But that’s something we’ll all face. The people that face those obstacles and overcome them are people whose dreams come true.
author: Tsugumi Ohba,  Bakuman, Volume 3: Debut and Impatience

quote: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly. It is the one thing we are interested in here.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are many realities. There are many versions of what may appearobvious. Whatever appears as the unshakeable truth, its exact oppositemay also be true in another context. After all, one's reality is butperception, viewed through various prisms of context.
author: Amish Tripathi,  The Immortals of Meluha

quote: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.
author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

quote: Between memory and reality there are awkward discrepancies...
author: Eileen Chang

quote: Reality is, you know, the tip of an iceberg of irrationality that we've managed to drag ourselves up onto for a few panting moments before we slip back into the sea of the unreal.
author: Terence McKenna
